Ok, here's how I got it to work:

1)  Unrar (extract) the files in CD 1 and CD 2 folder using WinRar (a freeware program readily available on the web). It will not extract simply by double-clicking, especially if the file isn't conveniently named. For example: .001, .002, .003, etc. To extract, simply select the first file in the folder (".001" file), right-click to open the menu, and select WinRar from the list. You should be able to view the contents almost immediately, although extracting them may take minutes. Make sure you extract the contents (which should be one ".cue" and one ".bin" file per folder) to the original CD 1 and CD 2 folders...for convenience.

2)  Once these .cue and .bin files are extracted, use a virtual drive program ("Alcohol 120%" is simple and easy to use) to mount and load the files, in other words, to play the damn things! This program creates a "virtual" DVD on a "virtual" DVD drive on your computer and allows you to install the game onto to your physical hard drive by make it think there's an actual DVD in your fake DVD drive. Cool, huh?

3)  The installation will require the following 3 things:

a.  The serial # (included in the .nfo file which is located in the general area of the "Star Wars Republic Commando" folder). Be sure to use Notepad to open this file. Again, this will not open simply by double-clicking it. You must open it manually, selecting Notepad from the list of programs by right-clicking the .nfo file.

b.  You will be asked to insert CD 2 to complete the installation. When prompted, go back into "Alcohol 120%" and by right-clicking the virtual drive, you can simply "un-mount" the CD 1 .cue file, "mount" the CD 2 .cue file, and "load" the file onto the virtual drive. (Right-clicking the virtual drive within "Alcohol 120%" makes these three options readily available.) Now go back to the install and click 'OK' on the window that asked for CD 2. NOTE: It may ask for CD 1 again after it installs CD 2. Simply repeat the previous step and click 'OK' to finish the install.

c.  Lastly, replace the legitimate .exe with the cracked .exe.  in order to play the game. This is how: 

In "My Computer", right-click the virtual drive now called "Commando_1", and select "Explore" to view its folders. In the folder called "PCGAME", copy the "SWRepublicCommando" file and replace (paste over) the original "SWRepublicCommando" file, which is located on the physical drive. The directory in which it lives should look like this:

C:Program FilesLucasArtsStar Wars Republic CommandoGameDataSystem

Now you're ready to play! Just create a shortcut of the cracked .exe to your Desktop and enjoy!

This guy used the most off the wall way to archive these files.... anyways here's what you do.

You need 2 programs - WinRAR, and One of the following... Alcohol, Daemon Tools, or PowerISO.

(I used Alcohol...)

Once done downloading, go into each folder, both CD1, and CD2. Find the first .001 file, right click them, choose Open With... And choose WinRAR. Extract each to a folder of your choice. 

That done, open one of your ISO managing programs. In my case, Alcohol. Mount CD1 onto the virtual drive. Leave it open, as you will need to use it several times during install. When the Lucas Arts CD opens, choose open. Using the serial from the .nfo file, or from above, Install. Halfway through the install, it will prompt you to insert disc 2. Alt tab over to your program (Alcohol), and choose cd2 to mount on your virtual drive. That done, alt tab back to the program, and hit OK. It will continue, then when done it will ask for disc 1 again. Alt tab back, and mount cd1. Finish. 

When done, find the directory where you installed it, ie C:/Program Files/Lucas Arts/Star Wars... Leave that folder open. Then go to your virtual drive and open the cd1. Under PCGAME there's a .exe file. Place that in the folder you left open. To start the game, run it from that .exe file, known as a no cd crack.

TaDA! Hope that helps all you noobies.

Ok Guys i'm gonna tell you exactly how i installed this game in a precisely detail, for those who are a bit noobie in this area.

Finish
